original_title: Two types of ancient human ancestors coexisted more than 2 million years ago, fossils show | CNN
article_summary: Archaeologists discovered fossilized teeth in Ethiopia's Afar Region, indicating two human ancestor species, Australopithecus and Homo, coexisted around 2.6-2.8 million years ago. The findings challenge the linear view of human evolution, suggesting it is more complex and diverse.</s>
